basics.name: Alyssa Player
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary: An upcoming Data Science Master's graduate seeking opportunities in the digital marketing, media, and entertainment industries.

work.name: California Institute of Technology
work.summary: Research and laboratory management for the Beacon Opto-Fluidic Platform.
highlights: Utilize the Beacon Opto-Fluidic Platform to develop novel antibody therapeutics against SARS-COV2 and HIV pathogens
Plan, execute, and monitor laboratory experiments daily, ensuring all processes are carried out efficiently with diagnostic QA/QC
Maintain database organization and ensure accurate tracking and interpretation of results of ongoing projects
Deliver high-quality and comprehensive deliverables to collaborators within the two-week mark of project commencement
Continuously update and embed several programs into spreadsheets using JavaScript for improved functionality
Organize multi-format collaborative meetings with clients and sponsors to ensure clear expectations and project goals
Create visual graphics and images for educational materials, promotional resources, and web design for the center
Dedicated member of ‘Caltech Green Labs’ aiming to promote sustainable within laboratory science

work.name: Vantuna Research Group, Occidental College
work.summary: Undergraduate Research Assistant and Student Mentor.
highlights: Completed a two-year independently driven Honors Thesis that studied artificial reefs as conservation habits for climate-threatened species along the Southern California Bight with analyses completed in R
Participated in field sample collection, preparation, and data compilation for ongoing government-funded monitoring projects
Entered and analyzed quantitative field data in Excel to produce annual reports on the progress of ongoing projects and maintain performance standards
Mentored 5-10 new students per semester in efficient lab practices, sample collection, and data entry during weekly office hours
Trained on substrate population transects on SCUBA to collect field data for annual quantitative population surveys

Collaborated with the Discovery Bay Marine Lab, Jamaica as a Richter Trust Scholar on a two-week data collection trip for an ongoing reef monitoring/ coral restoration project to observe annual organismal growth and recruitment to the reefs

volunteer.organization: Green Labs, California Institute of Technology
volunteer.summary: Assist outreach initiatives to educate the Caltech research community on sustainable practices and waste diversion strategies.
Serve as a STEM pen-pal mentor to inspire curiosity and expand the student's perspective on the scientific profession.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
